item.title: 招聘结果显示，前景艰难，绿芽初露
item.description: 欧洲和美国的招聘公司在经历了年初的惨淡经营后，在第二季度出现了微弱的企稳迹象。要想扭转颓势，仍有赖于下半年的大幅改善。【原文：Recruiters across Europe and the US showed timid signs of stabilization in the second quarter after a dismal start to the year. Any reversal of fortunes still hinges on a drastic improvement in the second half.】

item.title: 加拿大意外裁员 4.08 万人，创大流行病以来之最
item.description: 自 2022 年 1 月以来，加拿大经济失去的工作岗位最多，除大流行病外，这是七年来最大的降幅。【原文：The Canadian economy lost the most jobs since January 2022, and excluding the pandemic, it’s the largest drop in seven years.】

item.title: 降息后智利年度通胀意外加快
item.description: 在智利央行表示将在未来几个季度逐步降低借贷成本之后，智利的年度通胀率自 3 月份以来首次出人意料地加速上升。【原文：Chile’s annual inflation unexpectedly accelerated for the first time since March after the central bank signaled it will gradually lower its borrowing costs over coming quarters.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚维持利率不变，增税将加剧通货膨胀
item.description: 罗马尼亚央行维持利率不变，因为该国正在为一系列旨在遏制预算赤字的增税措施带来的通胀激增做准备。【原文：Romania’s central bank kept interest rates unchanged as the country braces for an inflation surge from a series of tax hikes designed to curb the budget deficit.】

item.title: 拥有人工智能故事的绿色科技公司财源滚滚
item.description:
随着数据中心开发商寻求能够为人工智能提供全天候电力的无碳资源，长期以来备受冷落的核能和地热资源正受到热捧。【原文：

Long-unloved nuclear and geothermal are experiencing a boom in interest as data center developers seek carbon-free resources capable of delivering round-the-clock electricity to power artificial intelligence.

】

item.title: 重油产量回升，美国炼油商看好利润率
item.description: 随着加拿大和中东产量的回升，美国炼油厂盈利能力的一个关键驱动因素--以低价购买重质原油的能力--将在下半年得到改善。【原文：A key driver of US refiners’ profitability — the ability to buy heavy crude at cheap prices — is set to improve in the second half of the year as Canadian and Middle Eastern production rebounds.】

item.title: 华尔街和人工智能初创公司正在争夺入门级研究人员
item.description: 在曼哈顿下东区的一个屋顶酒吧里，大约 150 名量子研究人员与人工智能初创公司 Anthropic 的员工会面，后者恳请他们考虑远离华尔街的生活。【原文：At a rooftop bar on Manhattan’s Lower East Side, roughly 150 quant researchers met with employees at the artificial-intelligence startup Anthropic who implored them to consider a life away from Wall Street.】

item.title: 刚果和平可能预示着与美国公司达成价值 7 亿美元的电力交易
item.description: Symbion 电力有限责任公司提议，如果刚果民主共和国和卢旺达能够执行最近由美国支持的和平协议，将在两国边境建造一座 140 兆瓦的发电厂和输电线路。【原文：Symbion Power LLC is proposing a 140-megawatt power plant and transmission lines along the border of Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda if the two countries can implement a recent US-backed peace agreement.】

item.title: 印度批准向液化石油气补贴销售企业提供 34 亿美元援助
item.description: 印度内阁周五批准向国营燃料零售商一次性支付 3,000 亿卢比（约合 34 亿美元），以补偿他们以补贴价格向贫困家庭出售液化石油气。【原文：India’s cabinet on Friday approved a one-time payout of 300 billion rupees ($3.4 billion) for state-run fuel retailers to compensate them for selling liquefied petroleum gas to poor households at subsidized rates.】

item.title: 梅西、米莱和米老鼠吸引阿根廷游客赴美旅游
item.description: 弗朗西斯科-冈萨雷斯-加莱（Francisco González Galé）没想到，今年早些时候，当他实现孩子们的愿望，从布宜诺斯艾利斯前往奥兰多迪斯尼世界时，会有一种宾至如归的感觉。这位 46 岁的阿根廷律师过去每隔几年就会飞往美国一次，但在 2025 年，他已经去过美国两次了。【原文：Francisco González Galé didn’t expect to feel so at home when he fulfilled his kids’ wishes earlier this year by traveling to Walt Disney World in Orlando from Buenos Aires. The 46-year-old Argentine lawyer used to fly to the US once every couple of years, but he’s already been stateside twice in 2025.】

item.title: Glencore 调整交易团队，煤炭主管将离职
item.description: 嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc）庞大的煤炭交易业务主管即将离职，这是该公司交易部门多年来最大的一次调整。【原文：The head of Glencore Plc’s huge coal-trading operation is leaving in the biggest shake-up of the company’s trading unit in years.】

item.title: 普利司通计划在美国和欧洲实现增长以抵消巴西的损失
item.description: 普利司通公司（Bridgestone Corp.）计划通过重振其百年品牌凡士通（Firestone）和提高北美产量来抵消巴西市场的亏损，从而在关税压力下提高在美国和欧洲的销量。【原文：Bridgestone Corp. plans to offset losses in Brazil by revitalizing its century-old Firestone brand and boosting North American production in a campaign to ramp up sales in the US and Europe amid tariff pressures.】

item.description: 软银集团（SoftBank Group Corp. ）是富士康科技集团（Foxconn Technology Group）位于俄亥俄州的电动汽车工厂的买方，此举旨在启动这家日本公司与 OpenAI 和甲骨文公司合作的价值 5000 亿美元的星际之门数据中心项目。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. is the buyer taking ownership of Foxconn Technology Group’s electric vehicle plant in Ohio, a move aimed at kick-starting the Japanese company’s $500 billion Stargate data center project with OpenAI and Oracle Corp.】

item.title: 神兄妹》的余波笼罩着脆弱的泰柬休战
item.description: 泰国和柬埔寨在上个月的冲突中造成 40 多人死亡，30 万人流离失所，两国于周四同意采取一系列措施帮助维持边境和平。【原文：Thailand and Cambodia on Thursday agreed to a set of measures to help maintain peace along their border after clashes last month killed more than 40 people and displaced 300,000.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行估值进一步落后，BBVA 排名第一
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）长期以来一直是欧盟最有价值的银行，但如今已跌至第五位，凸显出其股价落后于同行。【原文：BNP Paribas SA, long the European Union’s most valuable bank, has dropped to fifth place, highlighting how its stock is trailing peers.】

Ltd. in the hope of gauging the state of the operation days before a key permit expires, a symptom of the acute supply anxiety that has gripped the market.】

item.title: 汇丰银行新设金丝雀码头办事处，同时缩减城市总部规模
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）在同意将其全球总部迁至伦敦金融城两年后，签署了金丝雀码头（Canary Wharf）新增办公空间的租约。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc has signed a lease for additional office space in Canary Wharf two years after agreeing to shift its global headquarters to the City of London.】

item.title: 特朗普关税让国际股市再次伟大
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策给国际股市带来了严重的提振，同时也帮助结束了标准普尔500指数（S&P 500 Index）在全球的主导地位— 至少目前是这样。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are giving international stocks a serious lift and at the same time helping to end the S&P 500 Index’s run of global dominance — at least for now.】

item.title: 阿联酋航空扩大电子产品限制，禁止使用移动电源
item.description: 阿联酋航空将禁止在航班上使用电源箱，只允许乘客携带一个此类设备登机，进一步限制旅客携带电子产品登机。【原文：Emirates will ban the use of power banks aboard its flights and only allow passengers to bring one such device onto the plane, further restricting travelers from carrying electronic gadgets on aircraft.】

item.description: 阿拉斯加州是总部位于旧金山的美联储第 12 区的其中一个州。对于旧金山联储主席玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）来说，阿拉斯加州目前是美国整体经济的领先指标。在安克雷奇的一次美联储巡回采访中，戴利向我们讲述了她从该州企业中了解到的情况，这些情况与美国其他地区经济的关系，以及她如何利用在当地了解到的情况为货币政策提供最佳指导。我们还将了解到她的重大计划【原文：Alaska is one of the states in the Federal Reserve’s 12th District, which is headquartered in San Francisco. For Mary Daly, the president of the SF Fed, the state right now is a leading indicator for the US economy overall. In an interview recorded on a Fed tour in Anchorage, Daly tells us what she’s learning from businesses in the state, how it relates to the rest of the US economy, and how she uses what she’s learning on the ground in order to best guide monetary policy.
